In the DRC, Chinese and American companies race for lithium
description: In the southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo, the city of Manono sits atop the world's largest reserves of this mineral essential to the energy transition. A Chinese group signed the first contract there in 2022, followed this year by a California-based company.

headline: Tour de France Femmes: Le Court makes history for Africa with fifth-stage victory

US Treasury sanctions Brazilian judge overseeing Bolsonaro trial
description: The US Treasury issued new sanctions on Brazilian Supreme Court Justice Alexandre de Moraes, known for his role in the trial of Brazil's former far-right leader, Jair Bolsonaro, and his order to shut down X in 2024.

headline: UNICEF France calls for protecting underage victims of criminal exploitation rather than punishment
description: In a new report, the French branch of the UN agency highlights the lack of resources for identifying and protecting minors who are victims of criminal exploitation. It makes 75 recommendations for public authorities.

headline: Léon Marchand smashes 200m medley world record
description: In the semifinal of the world swimming championships, the French 23-year-old beat Ryan Lochte's record from 2011 by more than one second.

headline: 'I learned freedom at 34, and it was a revelation': Katja Lange-Müller, an eastern wind blows through West Berlin
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (3/6). Katja Lange-Müller, born in the German Democratic Republic (GDR), managed as an adult to cross 'to the other side' of the Wall, escaping her mother, a prominent member of the communist regime.

'In the West Berlin squats, we argued but lived together': Karin Wieland, political rebel
description: 'Being 20 in West Berlin' (2/6). In the late 1970s, Karin Wieland fled her small German town to live communally in an abandoned building in Kreuzberg, throwing herself into every cause of the era.

headline: Economist Dmitry Nekrasov: 'Only a handful of sanctions have had a serious effect on Putin's ability to continue the war'
description: Nekrasov, a former Kremlin adviser who joined the opposition and now lives in exile, discusses the EU's latest package of sanctions against Russia and their potential effectiveness.

headline: Letters from prisoners held in solitary confinement: 'I feel like becoming violent again'
description: Le Monde asked five prisoners and a former inmate – the armed robber Rédoine Faïd, four drug traffickers, and a radicalized Islamist – to recount daily life in solitary confinement.
byline: Grégoire Biseau,  Lucie Soullier and  Thomas Saintourens
